flawed_nl_solution:
For every acre of grass, the farmer can harvest 560/5 = <<560/5=112>>112 bales of hay each month.
This year, the farmer has 7 + 5 = <<7+5=17>>17 acres of grass.
He can expect to harvest 17 x 112 = <<17*112=1904>>1904 bales of hay per month.
The total hay production this year is 1904*12 = <<1904*12=22848>>22848
From September to December, the farmer would have to feed his horses for a total of 30 + 31 + 30 + 31 = <<30+31+30+31=122>>122 days
Each day his horse eats a total of 3*9 = <<3*9=27>>27 bales of hay.
For the 122 days, the horses will eat a total of 27*122 = <<27*122=3294>>3294 bales.
The total number of bales remaining will be 22848-3294 = <<22848-3294=19554>>19554.
#### 19554

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 12, not 17. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
